required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Examination of Low Wattage and High Wattage E-Cigarettes
clinical_study.official_title: Examination of Low Wattage and High Wattage E-Cigarettes

brief_summary.textblock: The overall aim of the proposed study is to evaluate the effect of switching from conventional cigarettes to either a LWe or HWe on smoking behavior, product use patterns and continued use, as well as biomarkers of toxicant exposure and effects.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week1, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 26, and Week 52
Baseline, Week1, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 26, and Week 52

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week -1, Baseline, Week 1, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 26 and Week 52
Baseline, Week 4, Week 12, Week 26, and Week 52
Baseline, Week 4, Week 12, Week 26, and Week 52
Baseline, Week 4, Week 12, Week 26, and Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: NNAL, NNN, N-HOMe-dAdo, N-ethylidene-dGuo, Total Nicotine Equivalents, Urine Creatinine, Breath CO

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4, Week 12, Week 26, and Week 52

intervention.description: The low wattage E cigarette device will be provided to the participant and they will be instructed to vape ad libitum for 12 weeks and then be assessed at 6 months and 12 months for continued use of device.

The high wattage E cigarette device will be provided to the participant and they will be instructed to vape ad libitum for 12 weeks and then be assessed at 6 months and 12 months for continued use of device.
The usual brand of cigarettes will be provided to the participant and they will be instructed to smoke ad libitum for the duration of the study.

facility.name: University of Oklahoma Health Sciences Center Tobacco Research Center
